summary: Build a comprehensive, responsive single-page web application called "ASD Screening Tool" based on M-CHAT-R logic with a child-friendly, medical-but-warm, clean underwater-themed design. Includes hero, disclaimer + demographic inputs (age in months + gender only), one-question-at-a-time questionnaire with progress, dynamic risk result dashboard (low/medium/high), and footer with FAQ + About sections.
architectural_notes: Single-page app flow with sections: Hero -> Disclaimer/Input -> Questionnaire -> Results -> Footer.
Do not collect or store respondent/child name; only collect age (months) and gender.
Questionnaire displays exactly one question per screen with progress indicator and YA/TIDAK responses.
Results page renders 3 states (low/medium/high risk) driven by M-CHAT-R scoring logic.
Branding constraints: underwater playful-professional theme; primary #29B6F6, secondary #AB47BC, accent #FF7043; background #E1F5FE/#FFFFFF; headings Nunito/Poppins; body Open Sans.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Underwater children diving/playing illustration, clean vector style, warm medical-friendly palette (hero-underwater-kids.dim_1200x600.png)

existing_features.title: Create a responsive single-page app flow for the ASD Screening Tool with these sections in order: (1) Hero, (2) Disclaimer + Demographics input, (3) Questionnaire (one question at a time), (4) Results dashboard, (5) Footer containing FAQ accordion and About content. Navigation between sections must be handled in-app (no full page reload).

Implement the specified visual style consistently across the app: underwater/kids playful but professional, child-friendly, medical-but-warm, clean. Apply the provided color palette (primary #29B6F6, secondary #AB47BC, accent/CTA #FF7043, background #E1F5FE or #FFFFFF) and typography (Nunito or Poppins for headings, Open Sans for body).

Build the Hero section with the specified headline, subheadline, hero illustration (provided as a static asset), and a large rounded primary CTA button labeled exactly "Cek Risiko Sekarang" that moves the user to the Disclaimer & Input section.

Create the Disclaimer & Input section in a card container with the specified disclaimer copy and ONLY these inputs: Age in months (dropdown) and Gender (radio). Remove/omit any name field entirely. Add a "Lanjut" button to proceed to the questionnaire.

Implement the Questionnaire interface to present exactly one M-CHAT-R question at a time with: a top progress bar (blue gradient), a card layout for the question text, two large answer buttons labeled exactly "YA" and "TIDAK" with clear green/red styling, and "Back"/"Next" navigation controls.

Implement M-CHAT-R scoring logic to compute a total risk score from the questionnaire answers and show a Results Dashboard with three visual states (Low/Medium/High) based on the score. Ensure the results screen displays the specified icon and guidance copy for each state.
Add a Footer section containing "Tentang Kami" and "FAQ" areas. Implement the FAQ as an accordion with the four provided Q&A entries, and include the About headline and body text exactly as provided.

Ensure privacy behavior aligns with the stated FAQ claim: do not permanently store personal identity data. The demographic inputs (age, gender) and questionnaire answers must be kept in-memory on the client for the session and be resettable by the user (e.g., restart screening).
Add the required generated illustration(s) as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the Hero section.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement SPA flow and layout: Hero, Disclaimer/Input, Questionnaire, Results Dashboard, Footer
Apply visual style/branding (underwater theme, specified color palette, Nunito/Poppins + Open Sans typography, responsive child-friendly UI)
Create Disclaimer & Input section with ONLY Age (months dropdown) and Gender (radio); remove Name field
Build questionnaire UI showing one M-CHAT-R question at a time with progress bar, YA/TIDAK buttons, Back/Next navigation
Implement M-CHAT-R scoring logic and Results Dashboard with 3 visual risk states (low/medium/high) and corresponding guidance copy
Add FAQ accordion content and About section content; include footer links (Tentang Kami, FAQ)
